body:
Comment 393 by **SIGTSTP**: 
Let's assume for one minute that you worked for a company with a market capitalization
of $180 billion 
dollars, and your team developed a new programming language that was going to be
released to the public. 
Everything needs a name, right? When selecting the name for this programming language,
wouldn't one think 
that due diligence would include:

1) a simple Bing search for existing languages of the same name
2) a search of academic literature for programming languages of the same name

So someone screwed up...  This happens.  It's time for the Google team to find a new
name, apologize, and at 
least give the perception that they do no evil.
